titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Roberta Price Papers and Photographs
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 20, 2019 at 03:02

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of photographs taken by Roberta Price of communes in the southwestern United States from 1969 to 1970, including black and white and color prints, negatives, and transparencies. The collection also includes drafts, correspondence, and printed material relating to Huerfano: A Memoir of Life in the Counterculture ; additional photographs; interviews and other born digital audiovisual materials; and other papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographs taken by Roberta Price of communes in the southwestern United States from 1969 to 1970, including black and white and color prints, negatives, and transparencies. The collection also includes drafts, correspondence, and printed material relating to Huerfano: A Memoir of Life in the Counterculture ; additional photographs; interviews and other born digital audiovisual materials; and other papers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Roberta Price on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Roberta Price Papers and Photographs. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 10 (digital media) and box 11 (videocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Roberta Price Papers and Photographs is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

bioghist.head: Roberta Price
bioghist.p: Roberta Price is a photographer, writer, and intellectual property attorney in Albuquerque, New Mexico. In 2004 the University of Massachusetts Press published Huerfano: A Memoir of Life in the Counterculture , based on Price's experience living in communes in the southwestern United States in the late 1960s and 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged roughly in the order in which the collection was received.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: 1 flash drive removed for separate housing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to: Zoar Valley, Buffalo (1969-1970); Washington D.C. and Buffalo; University of California, Berkeley; Frank Reed wedding photographs (1970).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to: Drop City, Summer '69; New Buffalo and Reality, Summer '69; Libre, Summer '69.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to: Summer '70; R.R. Struts party; early house construction; tipi site, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to: Libre (1970); Lama Foundation (1970); Reality Construction; Placitas domes, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to: University of Massachusetts; Huerfano.
